comment.body:
> [erkan](#comment_2_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): ... and no matter what kind of features are added, the most important one always is missing: interoperatibility with other social systems

Integration: highly desired in tech, terrible idea in capitalism. So _frustrating_.

Don't worry too much about running out of Namecoin. I have about $4.50 USD worth of Namecoin, and given what I've learned from [here](https://wiki.namecoin.info/index.php?title=Register_and_Configure_.bit_Domains#How_much_does_it_cost) and [here](https://www.coingecko.com/en/price_calculator/namecoin/usd), That'll last me about 1050 years.

Neat, I'll have to check that one out. Mind if I shamelessly pimp my own referral link?
http://moonbit.co.in/?ref=e8fca6bfe289
